value: Peer recovery specialists providing services in specialty courts must hold certification from a DHS‑approved accrediting entity through the Arkansas Peer Recovery Program and cannot be disqualified from Medicaid participation if their offense is non‑violent and they obtained certification after the offense.
notes: The Arkansas Peer Recovery Program provides a three‑tier credentialing process administered by the DHS Office of Substance Abuse and Mental Health; certification is authorized by Ark. Code §20‑64‑602(b)(19).  Ark. Code §20‑77‑135 prevents DHS from disqualifying a peer support specialist from Medicaid if certified by an accredited organization approved by the Arkansas Alcohol and Drug Abuse Coordinating Council and the offense is non‑violent.
